library

Interface DatabaseEntry

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Author, Book, BookType, Borrower, Fiction, Genre, NonFiction, Role, Series, Shop

    public interface DatabaseEntry
    An interface for all classes of objects that can be added to the database. The DatabaseEntry interface provides methods for adding, deleting and updating records in the database. It also provides a static instantiation of the Driver for access to method for connecting to the database and info or error messages.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Driver DRIVER 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addToDatabase()
      Adds this DatabaseEntry object to the database.
      boolean deleteFromDatabase()
      Deletes this DatabaseEntry object from the database.
      boolean updateInDatabase(java.lang.String field, java.lang.String newValue)
      Updates the given field of this DatabaseEntry object in the database.

    • Field Detail

      • DRIVER

        static final Driver DRIVER

    • Method Detail

      • addToDatabase

        boolean addToDatabase()
        Adds this DatabaseEntry object to the database. This method will set the object's id attribute and then return a boolean indicating the successfulness of the insertion.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating successful addition to database

      • deleteFromDatabase

        boolean deleteFromDatabase()
        Deletes this DatabaseEntry object from the database. This method will return a boolean indicating the successfulness of the deletion. There will always be a pop-up asking for confirmation of deletion.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating successful removal from database

      • updateInDatabase

        boolean updateInDatabase(java.lang.String field,
                         java.lang.String newValue)
        Updates the given field of this DatabaseEntry object in the database. The class variable's value in this Object will also be updated. This method will return a boolean indicating the successfulness of the update.
        Parameters:
        field - The field to update
        newValue - The new value of the field to update.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating successful update in the database
